Knight, Joseph (c. 1777-1855), British gardener and nurseryman. (<em>J. Knight</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 302; BB p. 176; BM 2: 997; Bret. p. 220;
Desmond p. 364; Hortus 3: 1197 ("Knight, J."); Jackson p. 141, 308, 410; Kew 3: 281;
Langman p. 412; MW p. 236; PR 4744-4745 (ed. 1: 5282); Rehder 5: 459; RS p. 90-91;
Tucker 1: 391; Zander ed. 10, p. 678.
Allan, M., Tom's Weeds 15-19. 1970.
Hadfield, M., Gardening in Britain 338-339. 1960.
Harvey, J., Early hort. catal., Bath 1973, p. 12.

3759. <em>On the cultivation of the plants belonging to the natural order of Proteeae</em>, with their generic as
well as specific characters and places where they grow wild. [London (William Sa-
vage)] 1809. Qu. (<em>Cult. Prot.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Dec 1809, p. [i]-xix, [1]-127, [128, ind.], err. slip. <em>Copies</em>: G, NY, USDA. – Preface and
	frontispiece both dated 1 Aug 1809. This shows that dates on plates are not necessarily
	dates of publication, since it is unlikely that Knight's preface was dated the day the book
	appeared. In the preface, Knight says "Perhaps few works have greater claims to
	originality than the present, not a single line being copied from any other. For the names
	only of the different Genera, their various authors are quoted, except those of R. A.
	Salisbury, Esq. whose manuscripts have been found so useful in every sheet." This implies
	that we have to accept the text as written by Knight himself, the new names "ex" rather
	than "in". He does in fact credit Salisbury with many names equally with R. Brown,
	Banks, Linnaeus, etc. See, however, the discussion by Britten (1886) and by Stearn (1960).
<em>Ref</em>.: Britten, J. Bot. 24: 296-300. 1886.
	Stearn, W. T., Introduction to R. Brown's Prodromus, p. xxxii, <em>facsimile</em> edition Wein-
	heim 1960.

3760. <em>A synopsis of the coniferous plants</em> grown in Great Britain, and sold by Knight and Perry, at
the Exotic nursery, King's Road, Chelsea. London (Longman, Brown, Green, and Long-
mans, ...) s.d. [1850]. Oct. (<em>Syn. conif. pl.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1850, p. [i]-iv, [1]-64. <em>Copies</em>: MICH, MO, NY, USDA.

Knight, Thomas Andrew (1759-1839), British horticulturist; president of the [Royal]
Horticultural Society 1811-1838. (<em>T. Knight</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown (Knight probably made no herbarium). Manuscripts at

3761. <em>Pomona herefordiensis</em>: containing coloured engravings of the old cider and perry fruits
of Herefordshire. With such new fruits as have been found to possess superior excellence.

<em>Publ</em>.: 1811, p. [i*], [i]-viii, [1, index], <em>pl. 1-30</em> (numbered in index) with 2 (nos. <em>1, 2, 4, 14, 22,
	23, 27</em>) or 1 p. of text [37 p.]. <em>Copies</em>: GB, HH, UC, USDA, WAG. (information D. Johnson
	(UC) and B. Peterson (GB)). The plates engraved by William Hooker; artists Elizabeth
	Matthews (27) and Frances Knight (née Felton).

Kniphof, Johann[es] Hieronymous (1704-1763), German botanist, professor of botany
at Erfurt (1745-1756). (<em>Kniph</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 3: 59; Backer p. 304; Barnhart 2: 303; BM 2: 997;

probably is also dedicated to him.

3762. Facultatis medicae in perantiqua universitate hierana Jo. Hieronymus Kniphof ...
utile et jucundum in materia medica connexum considerans lectori benevolo salutem
precatur eundemque ad disputationem inauguralem <em>de radice Chinae</em> ejusque limitandis
laudibus officiose et decenter invitat. Erfordiae (Stanno Heringiano acad. typogr.) s.d. Qu. (<em>Rad. Chinae</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1753, p. [i-viii]. <em>Copy</em>: B. – To be considered pre-linnaean.
<em>Ref</em>.: Zuchold, Jahresber. naturf. Ges. Halle 5: 29. 1853.

3763. D. Io. Hieron. Kniphofii ... <em>Botanica in originali</em> seu herbarium vivum in quo
plantarum tam indiginarum quam exoticarum peculiari quadam operosaque enchiresi
atramento impressorio obductarum nominibusque suis ad methodum illustrium nostri aevi
botanicarum Linnaeai et Ludwigii insignitarum elegantissima ectypa exhibentur opera et
studio Ioannis Godofredi Trampe typographi halensis ... Hale magdeburgicae [Halle a. S.]
(J. G. Trampe) 1757-1764). 12 Centuries. Fol. (<em>Bot. orig.</em>)

PAGE: 579
HEADING: KNOCHE

<em>Ed. 1</em>: The NY copy of this edition has all 12 centuries bound in four volumes. The plates are
	alphabetically arranged per volume (3 centuries each), preceded by the title-pages of the
	centuries: cent. 1-3 have 299; 4-6, 301; 7-9, 302 and 10-12 300 plates, followed by the
	index universalis (see below). Copies vary. See Fischer for details and location of copies.
	Not all copies have coloured plates.
	A single copy of 1186 plates (PR 4752) dated Erfurt, 2 volumes 1748 and 1749, exists in the
	Stadt-Bibliothek, Erfurt. Another such preparatory stage, dated Erfurt 1748, changed to
	1751, is at the Hunt Botanical Library (HU 534) (590 plates).

<em>Ed. 2</em>: Cent. 1-6 were reprinted on larger paper for new subscribers. Each century has a
	separate t.p. (nos. ii and iii partly in ink on original cent, i t.p.). The plates are coloured
	nature prints.
	<em>Cent. 1</em>: [i-xxiv], [1]-14, <em>pl. 1-152</em> (t.p. counts as plate). 1763.
	<em>Cent. 2</em>: <em>pl. 154-190.</em> 1763.
	<em>Cent. 3</em>: <em>pl. 191-357.</em> 1738.
	<em>Cent. 4</em>: <em>pl. 358-435.</em> 1763.
	<em>Cent. 5</em>: <em>pl. 436-555.</em> 1763.
	<em>Cent. 6</em>: <em>pl. 556-687.</em> 1759.
	<em>Cent. 7</em>: <em>pl. 688-722, 724-768.</em> 1763.
	<em>Cent. 8</em>: <em>pl. 769-813.</em> 1761.
	<em>Cent. 9</em>: <em>pl. 815-950.</em> 1762.
	<em>Cent. 10</em>: <em>pl. 951-1082.</em> 1763.
	<em>Cent. 11</em>: <em>pl. 1083-1143.</em> 1764.
	<em>Cent. 12</em>: <em>pl. 1144-1213.</em> 1764.
	This is the composition of the <em>copy</em> at BR. For variations and full details see Fischer. In
	general the copies have 1200 pl. (BR copy reaches <em>pl. 723</em>).

<em>Index universalis</em> in omnes xii. centurias botanicae in originali d. I. O. Hieron. Kniphofii seu
	herbarii vivi in quo ... Halae magdeburgicae (apud Ioanne Godofredo Trampe) 1767.
	Fol., 14 p. <em>Copy</em>: NY.

<em>Ref</em>.: Blunt p. 139, 141; DU 170; Fischer no. 7; HU 534 (extensive details).
	Anon., Bull. misc. Inf. Kew 1895: 157 (copy at K, 1201 <em>pl</em>.).
	Thienemann, Arch. Gesch. Naturw. Techn. 1910: 154-155.

Knoblauch, Emil Friedrich (1864-1936), German botanist. (<em>Knobl</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 303; BJI 1: 32; BM 2: 998; CSP 16: 338; Kew 3:
281; Langman p. 412; MW p. 236, suppl. p. 166; Rehder 5: 460; Tucker 1: 392.

	Brandenburg 77: 138. 1937.
Dolezal, H., Friedrich Welwitsch 197. 1974.

(a) <em>Oleaceae</em>, IV. 2: 1-16, publ.: Aug 1892.
(b) <em>Salvadoraceae</em>, IV. 2: 17-19, publ.: Aug 1892.

Knoche, [Edward Louis] Herman (1870-1945), American botanist of German descent
at Stanford; studied at Stanford 1895-1899; with Charles Flahault at Montpellier 1904-
1917, in the United States and travelling until 1945. (<em>Knoche</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: DS (126.000 sheets); other material B, CR, K, L, MPU.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Knoche was a man of considerable wealth. The Stanford Alumni Directory of 1904
lists him as "capitalist" and "amateur botanist" (Thomas 1959), at a time in which neither of
these denominations were derogatory. Knoche brought together a considerable library
which contained e.g. the private reprint collection of Adolf Engler, purchased in 1930,
(25.000 items). The collection is now part of the Dudley Herbarium library together with

PAGE: 580
HEADING: KNOCHE

Knoche's herbarium; both are now housed at the California Academy of Sciences, together
with but kept separate from the holdings of CAS.

3766. <em>Pomologia</em>, dat is beschryvingen en afbeeldingen van de beste soorten van appels en
peeren, welke in Neder-en Hoog-Duitsland, Frankrijk, Engelland en elders geagt zyn, en tot
dien einde gecultiveert worden. Beschreven, naar het leven geteekent, en met de natuurlijke
coleuren afgezet door Johann Hermann Knoop ... te Leeuwarden (by Abraham Ferwerda,
Boekverkoper) 1758. Fol. (<em>Pomologia</em>).

3767. <em>Fructologia</em>, of Beschryving der vrugtbomen en vruchten die men in de hoven plant en
onderhoud: waarby derzelver differente benamingen, groey-plaatzen, voortteeling, cultuur,
en huishoudelijk gebruik, als mede het confyten en meer andere toebereidingen der vrugten,
enz., nauwkeurig aangewezen worden. Alles door een veeljarige ondervinding opgestelt, ten
dienste en vergenoegen der tuin-liefhebbers, door Johann Hermann Knoop. Met platen,
vertonende alle vrugten naar het leven, die in dit werk vervat zijn. Te Leeuwarden (gedrukt
by Abraham Ferwerda en Gerrit Tresling, boekverkopers) 1763. Fol. (<em>Fructologia</em>).

<em>Orig. ed.</em>: 1763 (p. [iv]: 1 Feb 1763), p. [i-iv], 1-132. <em>pl. 1-19</em> (hand-col. copp. author). <em>Copies</em>:
	FAS, UC (<em>18 pl</em>.), USDA.
<em>Ed</em>. [<em>2</em>]: with undated and corrected t.p., reset text, "<em>Fructologia</em>, ... onderhout; ...
	benamingen voortteeling, groei-plaatzen, cultuur, ..." Te Leeuwarden (by A. Ferwerda
	en G. Tresling, boekverkopers) s.d. Fol., p. [i.iv], 1-70, <em>pl. 1-19</em> (id.). <em>Copies</em>: MO, NY,
	USDA.
<em>Ed</em>. [<em>3</em>]: new t.p., text of ed. [2], "<em>Beschrijving van vruchtboom en vruchten</em>, die men in hoven plant
	en onderhoudt, met ..." Te Amsterdam en Dordrecht (by Allart, Holtrop, de Leeuw en
	Krop) 1790. Fol., p. [i-iv], 1-70, <em>pl. 1-19</em> (id.). <em>Copy</em>: BR.
<em>French ed</em>.: "<em>Fructologie</em> ou description des arbres fruitiers ainsi que des fruits que l'on plante et
	qu'on cultive ordinairement dans les jardins avec une explication détaillée de leurs
	différentes dénominations, de leur païs natal, de leur propagation, de leur culture &amp; de
	leur usage oeconomique, ainsi que de la manière de confire &amp; des diverses façons de
	préparer les fruits &amp;c. Le tout demontré par une expérience de plusieurs années, &amp; exposé
	pour l'utilité &amp; la satisfaction des amateurs du jardinage par Jean Herman Knoop avec
	figures représentant au naturel toutes les sortes de fruits contenuës dans cet ouvrage." À
	Amsterdam (chez la veuve K. van Tongerlo &amp; fils) 1768. Fol., [i-iv], 1-205, [1, ind.], <em>pl. 1-
	19. Copy</em>: UC (inf. D. E. Johnson). See also HU 620.
<em>Other Issue</em>: 1771, Amsterdam (Chez M. Magérus, libraire), p. [i], 1-205, [206, ind.], <em>pl. 1-14.</em>
	<em>Copy</em>: USDA.
<em>German ed</em>.: 1766, "<em>Pomologia</em>, das ist Beschreibungen und Abbildungen der beste Arten der
	Aepfel, Birnen, Kirschen une einiger Pflaumen, ... Zweyter Theil." Nürnberg (Im
	Verlag der Seligmännischen Erben) 1766. Fol., p. [i-vi], [1]-42, [i-ii], <em>pl. 1-13, 1-11</em> (id.).
	<em>Copies</em>: MO, USDA. – New text; <em>author</em>: J. C. Zinck, artist J. Ch. Sänger. – Not really a
	translation of the <em>Fructologia</em>.

3768. <em>Dendrologia</em>, of beschryving der plantagie-gewassen, die men in tuinen cultiveert,
zowel om te dienen tot cieraad, om daar van allées, cingels, heggen, berçeaux, cabinets,
pyramiden, plaisier-bosschen, enz., als tot huishoudelijk gebruik, te planten. Waarby
derzelver differente benamingen, groey-plaatzen, aankweeking en verdere onderhouding,
en vervolgens haar tuin- en huishoudelijke gebruiken, nauwkeurig beschreeven en aange-
wezen worden. Alles door een eige veeljarige ondervinding, ten dienste en vermaak der tuin-
beminnaars opgestelt door Johann Hermann Knoop. Te Leeuwarden (gedrukt by Abraham
Ferwerda en Gerrit Tresling, boekverkopers), 1763. Fol. (<em>Dendrologia</em>).

3770. <em>Thesaurus rei herbariae</em> hortensisque universalis, exhibens figuras florum, herbarum,
arborum, fruticum, aliarumque plantarum prorsas novas, et ad ipsos delineatas depictasque
archetypos nativis coloribus, atque idiomate tam latino quam germanico describens eorun-
dem partes, formam et habitum, nec non usum in officinis pharmaceutics, vita communi, et
medicina, prout Imgula haec nova docvit applicata observatio et archetyporum exacta
contemplatio. Apud Georgium Wolfgangum Knorr. mdccl. Allgemeines Blumen-Kräuter-
Frucht- und Garten-Buch ... in Nürnberg bey Georg Wolfgang Knorr. Daselbst gedruckt
bey Joh. Joseph Fleischmann. 1750 [-1772], 2 parts. Fol. (<em>Thes. rei. herb.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: In two parts (bound in two or three volumes), 1750-1772. For a precise collation and
	bibliographical details see Collins (in Sotheby) and Callery (1976). The total number of
	plates is <em>301</em> on <em>300</em> leaves. Some copies have a 1770 t.p. for part I. The pagination formula
	below is that of the <em>copy at BR</em>. Copies show minor variations.

<em>1</em>: in parts, 1750-1771, p. [i-x], 1-30, 1-26, 1-236, 1-24, 1-54, 1-34, <em>pl. A, A1-A14, B, B1-B3, C.
	C1-C2, D, E, E1-E5</em> [HU: <em>E1, E1a, E2-E4</em>], <em>F, Fa, F1-F10, G, G1-G5, G5a, G5b, G6-G8, H,
	H1-H10, J, J1-J6, K, K1-K2, K2a, K2b, K3-K6, L, L1-L13, M, MI-M5, N, N1-N12, P, P1-
	P5, Q, R, R1-R14</em> [R8 and <em>R9</em> on one plate], <em>R14a, R15-R23, S, S1-S6, S6a, S6-S19, S19a, S20-
	S23, T, T1-T2, V, V1, W, W1-W11, Z, Z1-Z2. – Copies</em>: B, BR, G, HU.
<em>2</em>: "pars secunda. Apud Georgii Wolfgangi Knorrii haeredes. mdcclxxii ..." "Gedruckt
	bey Paul Jonathan Felssecker seel. Wittib. 1772", p. [i-vi], 1-130, [1-22, index], 101 plates
	numbered: <em>A1-A9, A9a, A10-A17, B, B1-B4, C, C1-C9, E, F, G, G1, H, I, L, L1-L11, M, M1,
	M1a, M2-M4, M4a, M5-M6, N, N1-N2, O, O1-O4, P, P1-P4, R, R1-R2, R2a, S, S1-S14, T,
	T1-T5, V, U1-U2, V2</em> [bis, with a different ill.; seen only in copy at BR]. <em>Copies</em>: BR, G, HU
	(text incomplete).
<em>1</em>, with 1770 t.p.: "... contemplatio. Pars prima. Apud Georgii Wolfgangi Knorrii haeredes
	mdcclxx ... erster Theil. Gedruckt bey Paul Jonathan Telssecker. 1770. Fol., portrait
	author, p. [i-xv], 1-30, 1-26, 1-236, 1-24, 1-54, 1-34, plates as in "1750" issue. <em>Copies</em>: NY.

Knowlton, Frank Hall (1860-1926), American geologist, taxidermist and botanist at
Georg Washington [Columbian] University, D. C. (1887-1896); from 1894 palaeobotanist

Knuth, Paul Erich Otto Wilhelm (1854-1899). German botanist educated at Greifs-
wald; Dr. phil. 1876; high school teacher at Iserlohn 1876, from 1881 at Kiel; author of a
Handbuch der Blütenbiologie. (<em>P. Knuth</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Was left at the Real-Gymnasium, Kiel; present location unknown.
Material in alcohol at B.

Knuth's <em>Flora</em> was simply an enthusiastic but not very critical compilation. It faded towards
oblivion after the publication of P. Prahl's <em>Krit. Fl. Schleswig-Holstein.</em>

Koch, Karl [Carl] Heinrich Emil (1809-1879), German botanist; traveller in the Orient;
dendrologist; horticulturist; at Würzburg 1831-1833; Dr. med. Würzburg 1833; at Jena
1835; travelled in the Kaukasus and Central Asia 1837-1838 and 1843-1844; from 1847
botanist ("Adjunkt") at the Berlin Botanical Garden. (<em>K. Koch</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Koch's herbarium was acquired by Berlin (B) in 1913 and was
destroyed 1/2 March 1943. A number of duplicates is still extant, among them material
collected by Koch himself. Other specimens are at G, H, GOET, LE, MEL, MO, P, W. (See
Edmondson and Lack 1977 and Lack 1978).
<em>Ref</em>.: Koch, C., Reise durch Russland und den kaukasischen Isthmus in den Jahren 1836,
	1837 und 1838, 2 vols., 1842, 1843. Stuttgart &amp; Tübingen (itin.); Wanderungen im
	Oriente, während der Jahre 1843 und 1844, 3 vols., 1846, 1847. Weimar (itin.).
	Ulbrich, O. E., Notizbl. bot. Gart. Mus. Berlin-Dahlem 6: 420-434. 1917 (extensive descr.
	of herb.).
	Pilger, R., Mitt. bot. Gart. Mus. Berlin-Dahlem 1(1): 19. 1953.
	Edmondson, J. R., Taxon 25: 256. 1976 (request for information).
	Edmondson, J. R. &amp; Lack, H. W., Notes R. Bot. Gard. Edinburgh 35(3): 321-344. 1977
	(The Turkish collections of K., eastern Anatolia 1837, 1843; types, collections, itin-
	erary).
	Lack, H. W., Willdenowia 8(2): 431-438. 1978 (detailed history of herbarium); Notes R.
	Bot. Gard. Edinburgh 37(1): 79-94. 1978 (Caucasian coll.).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>:ADB 16: 395-398; AG 6(1): 313-314; Barnhart 2: 306; BFM
31; BM 2: 1002; Bossert p. 215; CSP 3: 705, 8: 99, 10: 426, 12: 397; DTS 1: 155-156; Frank
3(Anh.): 51-52; Hortus 3: 1197; IF 710; IH 2: 373; Jackson p. 567 [index]; Kanitz 217; Kew
3: 287; Langman p. 414-415; LS 14182-14185; MW p. 237-239; NAF 28B(2): 340; NI 1083;
PR 4763-4771 (ed. 1: 5308-5310); Quenstedt p. 240; Rehder 5: 461-463; RS p. 91; TR 692-
697; TL-2/1: 1761; Tucker 1: 393-394; Urban-Berl. p. 144-145, 364; Zander ed. 10, p. 679.
Anon., Bot. Not. 1880: 28; Bot. Zeit. 37: 404. 1879, 38: 224. 1880 (sale library).

Koch, Wilhelm Daniel Joseph (1771-1849), German physician and botanist; Dr. med.
Giessen 1794; practiced at Kaiserslautern from 1797 until 1824, then professor of botany at
Erlangen. (<em>W. Koch</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: The type herbarium of the <em>Synopsis</em> was acquired by Suringar and is
now at L. The non-German part of the herbarium is at ER. Other material at G.

	Haussknecht, H. K., Flora 56: 403, 405. 1873.

	Reisland)) 1878. Oct.

	MO, NY, Regensburg.
	<em>Note</em>: Stein 1878, on Hallier's Neubearbeitung: "das Gute davon ist nicht neu und das
	Neue nicht gut." Hallier announced the 7th edition as "dem gegenwärtigen Standpunkte
	der Botanik gemäss gänzlich umgearbeitet." "Eine reine Buchdruckerspekulation"
	(Stein).
<em>Ed. 8</em>: Mai 1881 (p. ii:jan 1881; Nat. Nov. Mai 1881; Bot. Zeit. 27 Mai 1881),p. [i*], [i]-
	lxxiii, [1], [1]-802. <em>Copies</em>: B, L, M, NY.

	Stein, Österr. bot. Z. 28: 240-243. 1878.

Koehler, Alexander Daniel (1762-1828), [fictitious] German botanist stated to have
worked with Mutis in Colombia and to have travelled in Brazil, Peru and Chile.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: One of the fictitious botanists created by an unknown contributor to Appleton's
Dictionary of American Biography (ca. 1890) and cited by Barnhart as such (1919). Among
the books cited for him are a <em>Flora brasiliensis</em> (4 vols., Berlin, 1821-1823), a <em>Flora venezuelensis</em>
(4 vols., 1822), <em>Genera et species palmarum</em> (Stuttgart 1825), all obviously inspired by von
Martius (1794-1868), and <em>Conspectus polygalorum florae Brasilicae meridionalis</em> (2 vols., Berlin
1827), inspired by Auguste de Saint-Hilaire (1799-1853).
<em>Ref</em>.: Barnhart, J. H. J. New York Bot. Gard. 20: 174-175. 1919.

PAGE: 595
HEADING: KOEHNE

Köhler, Hermann Adolph (1834-1879), German botanist. (<em>Köhl</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BFM 434, 1809, 1892: BM 2: 1005; GF p. 62; Langman p.
415; ME 2: 542; NI 1085.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Neokoehleria</em> Schlechter (1912) is dedicated to E. (or H?) Koehler (<em>fl</em>. 1906-1913),
orchid collector in Peru.

3806. <em>Köhler's Medizinal-Pflanzen</em> in naturgetreuen Abbildungen mit Kurz erläuterndem

<em>3</em>: Lieferung 1-20, 1896-1898, p. [i*-v*], [i]-xxxiv, [1], <em>pl</em>. (<em>id</em>.): <em>1-80</em>.
	"III. (Ergönzungs-) Band. <em>Neueste Medizinalpflanzen</em> und Verwechselungen mit 80 Tafeln

	C. F. Schmidt.
<em>Reprint</em>: (vols. 1, 2): Berlin-Lichterfelde (Bermühler) 1923 (n.v.).

Koehne, Bernhard Adalbert Emil (1848-1918), German botanist and dendrologist; Dr.
phil. Berol. 1869; participated as "Vizefeldwebel beim Alexander Regiment" in the Battle of
Gravelotte (18 Aug 1870); teacher at the Friedrich-Werderschen Gewerbschule 1872-1880;
from 1880 at the then new Falk-Realgymnasium, both in Berlin; professor's title 1891; from
1913 retired; one of the founders (1881) of the Deutsche botanische Gesellschaft. (<em>Koehne</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (22.000). Exsiccatae: <em>Herbarium dendrologicum adumbrationibus illus-
tratum</em>, nos. 1-565, 1896-1905, sets at B, BM, C, G, GB, M, MANCH, OXF, S, STU, UPS,
W.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 6(2): 107;Barnhart 2: 308; BJI 1: 33, 2: 92; BM 2: 1005;
Bossert p. 216; Clokie p. 194; CSP 8: 103, 12: 398, 16: 366-367; DTS 6(4): 163; Hortus 3:
1197 ("Koehne"); IH 2: 374-375; Jackson p. 372; Kew 3: 289-290; Langman p. 415; MW p.
239-241; NAF 28B(2): 340; PR 4778; Rehder 5: 464; TL-2/1: 1713; Tucker 1: 395-396;
Urban-Berl. p. 364; Zander ed. 10, p. 679.
Anon., Bot. Not. 1918: 296; Mitt. deut. dendr. Ges. 1917: 248 (portr.; vice-president since
	1896).
Harms, H. A. T., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 36: (73)-(89). 1919 (portr., bibl.).
Koehne, B. A. E., Deut. Gärtnerzeit. (Moeller) 11(26): 306-307. Aug 1896 (portr.,
	autobiogr.; fide Harms 1919).
Merrill, E. D., Contr. U.S. natl. Herb. 30(1): 177. 1947.
Urban, I., Fl. bras. 1(1): 181-182. 1906 (orig. biogr. inf.).

(2) Eichler, <em>Blüthendiagramme</em> 2: 179-180. 1878, inf. on <em>Lythraceae</em>.

HEADING: KOEHNE

3807. <em>Über Blüthenentwicklung bei den Compositen</em>. Botanische Inaugural-Dissertation, zur
Erlangung der Doctorwürde in der philosophischen Facultät der Friedrich-Wilhelms-
Universität zu Berlin genehmigt und öffentlich zu vertheidigen am 26. Juli 1869 von Emil
Koehne aus Schlesien ... Berlin (Druck von Gustav Schade ...) s.d. [1869]. Oct. (<em>Bl.-
Entw. Compos.</em>).

<em>Thesis ed</em>.: 26 Jul 1869 (t.p.; Bot. Zeit. 6 Aug 1869; Flora rd. 20 Jul-20 Aug 1869); p. [i-iii],
	[1]-71, [72, theses], <em>pl. 1-3</em> (uncol. liths. author). <em>Copy</em>: B.
<em>Trade ed</em>.: 26 Jul-16 Aug 1869 (BSbF rd. 10 Jul-16 Aug 1869), p. [i-iii], [1]-71, <em>pl. 1-3</em> (id.).
	<em>Copies</em>: L, M, NY. – "... Botanische Inaugural-Dissertation, zur Erlangung der Doctor-
	würde in der Philosophie vorgelegt der philosophischen Facultät der Friedrich-Wilhelms-
	Universität zu Berlin..." Berlin (Verlag von Th. Chr. Fr. Enslin. (Adolph Enslin)) 1869.
Koehne equated the pappus of the Compositae with the calyx.
<em>Ref</em>.: Anon., Flora 52: 384, 398, 430. 1869; Bull. Soc. bot. France 16(bibl.): 109. 16 Aug
	1869.

Kölreuter, Joseph Gottlieb (1733-1806), German botanist; early student of flower

3825. <em>Der botanische Führer durch die Rheinpfalz</em>, oder Uebersicht aller bisher in der Rheinpfalz

HEADING: KOERBER

Koerber (Körber), Gustav Wilhelm (1817-1885), German-Silesian lichenologist; from
1842 high school teacher at the Elisabeth Gymnasium at Breslau; Dr. phil. berol. 1839, royal
professor 1862, extraord. prof. at Breslau University 1873; with Massalongo founder of the
"Italian-Silesian" school of lichenology. (<em>Koerb</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: L. – Other important collection (Nachlass Duft; constitutes the
herbarium made by Koerber after he had sold his main herbarium to L in 1881): WRSL;
other material BM, HSI, MSTR. Exsiccatae: <em>Lichenes selecti germanici</em>, fasc. 1-14, nos. 1-420,
Breslau 1856/8-1873, sets at B, FH, G, H, HBG, IBF, KIEL, L, M, O, NY, S. See Sayre
(1969) for further details.
<em>Ref</em>.: Anon., Flora 63: 274. 1880, Bot. Zeit. 38: 408. 1880 (herb. for sale), 39: 197. 1881
	(bought by L); Bot. Jahrb. 7, Beibl. 13: 3. 1885 (herb. at WRSL).
	Sayre, G., Mem. New York Bot. Gard. 19(1): 136-137. 1969.
	Hawksworth, D. L., Mycol. Handb. 183. 1974.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 309; Bossert p. 217; CSP 3: 732 (2-7, 9-12, 14),
8: 111-112, 10: 445, 12: 400, 16: 383; DTS 1: 159; Frank 3(Anh.): 52; GR p. 23-24, <em>pl</em>. [<em>14</em>],
cat. p. 66; IH 2: 379; Jackson p. 161, 225, 296; Kew 3: 291; Krempelhuber 2: 231-377, 643;
LS 14216-14241, 35535-35536; Maiwald p. 144, 153, 188, 190; PR 4803-4807 (ed. 1: 5343-
5344); Saccardo 1: 93; SBC p. 124; Stevenson p. 1247; TL-2/1: 866, 943.
Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 23: 203-204. 1885; Bot. Jahrb. 7, Beibl. 13: 2. 1885; Bot. Gaz. 10: 371.
	1885; Bot. Not. 1886: 39; Bot. Zeit. 43: 544. 1885; Jahresber. Schles. Ges. vaterl. Cultur
	63: 429-431. 1886; Leopoldina 21: 162. 1885.
Beck, G., Vegetationsverh. Illyr. Länder 37. 1901 (Veg. Erde 4).
B. St., Breslauer Zeit. 532, 1885 (cutting at G in Parerga).

Wittrock, V. B., Acta Horti Berg. 3(3): 140, <em>pl. 127.</em> 1905 (portr.).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Caflisch, J. F., <em>Uebersicht der Flora von Augsburg</em>, 1850, collaborator (see
no. 943).
(2) Discovered, with von Flotow, <em>Haematococrus pluvialis</em> in 1842 on the Hirschberg (Silesia).
The senior author published this find in Nov. Act. Leopoldina 20: 411-606. 1843 ("Ueber
<em>Haematococcus pluvialis</em>").

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Koerberia</em> A. Massalongo (1854); <em>Koerberiella</em>B. Stein (1879).

Körnicke, Friedrich August (1828-1908), German botanist; 1849 assistant curator at the
Berlin herbarium; 1856 at St. Petersburg; Dr. phil. berol. 1856; 1859-1867 lecturer, later
professor, at Waldau agricultural college near Königsberg; 1867-1898 at the agricultural
college at Poppelsdorf near Bonn as successor to Julius Sachs. (<em>Körn</em>.)

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BONN. – Other material at B, C, CN, E, G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 6(1): 735 (orig. inf.); Barnhart 2: 309; BM 2: 1009;
Bossert p. 218; CSP 3: 735, 8: 113, 10: 446, 12: 400, 16: 384; DTS 1: 379, 6(4): 163; Hortus 3:
1197 ("Körn."); IH 2: 380; Kew 3: 291; Langman p. 416; LS 14242-14250a, 35537; MW p.
241, suppl. p. 170; NAF 7(15): 1074; PR 4808-4809; Rehder 5: 465; Stevenson p. 1247; TR
706-707; Tucker 1: 396; Zander ed. 10, p. 679.

	berg 50: 151-156. 1909 (1910).

1867-Jul 1868.
(5) Körnicke und H. Werner, <em>Handbuch des Getreidebaus</em>, Bonn 1885, x, 469 p., <em>10 pl</em>.
(Körnicke: <em>Die Arten und Varietäten des Getreides</em>) (Nat. Nov. Nov(1) 1885); Neue Ausgabe
1887 (Nat. Nov. Mar(2) 1887.). – A second volume, 1010 p.,by H. Werner, <em>Die Sorten und der

Kofoid, Charles Atwood (1865-1947), American protozoologist and algologist of Danish
descent; Ph. D. Harvard 1894; with Illinois nat. hist. survey 1894-1903; at Univ. California,
Berkeley 1903-1936; assistant director San Diego zool. station 1907-1910; of La Jolla zool.
station (later: Scripps) 1910-1923; professor of zoology at Berkeley 1904-1936. (<em>Kof</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown; material at E, GH, LE, LIV, MSC. Kofoid left his rich
and large library (40.000 volumes; 120.000 reprints) to the University of California. His
zoological collections are also at Berkeley (Dept. Zool.). For letters and manuscripts see also
Taylor (1971).
<em>Ref</em>.: Cullen, J., Taxon 21: 730. 1972.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 309; BJI 2: 92; BM 2: 1009; Bossert p. 216; CSP
16: 387; Hirsch p. 155; IH 2: 376; Moebius p. 77; Nordstedt suppl. p. 9; Pennell p. 611.
Anon., Fortune 33(6): 157. 1946 (portr.).
Dotell, Nature 160: 115-116. 1947.
Ewan, J., <em>in</em> Cent. progr. nat. sci. 53. 1955.
Ewan, J. et al., Short hist. bot. U.S. 80. 1969.
Goldschmidt, Nat. Acad. Sci. Biogr. Mem. 26: 121-151. 1951 (portr., bibl. by H. Kirby; the
	main biography).
Kirby, Sci. Mo. 61: 415-418. 1945; Science 106: 462-463. 1947, Anat. Rev. 101: 403. 1948,
	Univ. Calif. Fac. Bull. 17: 80-82. 1948.
Noble, Bios 6: 243-249. 1935 (portr.).
Phillips, V. T. and M. E., Guide mss. Coll. Acad. Phila. p. 98, 239. 1963.
Taylor, Phycologia 10(1): 143-144. 1971 (on "Kofoidiana").

Mem. Mus. comp. Zool. Harvard 51: 1-766, <em>31 pl</em>. 1928. – See also 3842.

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Natl. Acad. Sci. Biogr. Mem. 26: under portr. opp. p. 121. 1951.

Kolb, Max (1829-1915), German gardener, worked in botanical gardens in Berlin and
Paris; from 1859 "Kön. Oberinspecktor am botanischen Garten in München." (<em>Kolb</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: M (if any).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 311; BM 2: 1011-1012; DTS 1: 160, 6(4): 57;
Jackson p. 429; Kew 3: 294; Langman p. 416; NW p. 244; PR 4815; Render 5: 466; Tucker
1: 396.
Anon., Gard. Chron. ser. 3. 46: 361. 1909 (80th birthday).
Bergdolt, E., Karl von Goebel 105, 106, 252. 1941.
Wittmack, M. C. L., Garten-Zeit. 3: 589-591. 1884 (portr.).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: We are grateful to Garteninspektor Josef Bogner and to I. Haesler at Munchen for
providing us with information on Kolb. Bergdolt (1941) notes: "Angeblich ein Sohn
Ludwigs I. von Bayern; verheiratet mit einer Pariserin, verstand es K. als Gartenoberinspek-
tor so etwas wie einen gesellschaftlichen Mittelpunkt in München zu bilden." Goebel (l.c. p.
105-106) speaks of "der gänzlich unfähige Kolb." Both statements must be accepted with
reservation: Goebel later did not do at all badly with the München botanical garden with or
notwithstanding Kolb.

Kolbe, Robert Wilhelm (1882-1960), Russian born diatomologist with Finnish na-
tionality, of German-Finnish-Russian descent; studied at the Friedrich-Wilhelms-Univer-
sität, Berlin 1898-1899 and at the Technische Hochschule Dresden until 1904; business
administrator in Russia until 1918; emigrated to Finland 1918/1919, returned to Germany
to take his degree in the natural sciences with e.g. Kolkwitz and Engler; diatomologist in
Germany until 1946, finally in Sweden at the Stockholm natural history museum. (<em>Kolbe</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: S-PA.
<em>Ref</em>.: Wornardt, W. W., Int. direct. Diat. 34. 1968.
	Koster, J., Taxon 18: 554. 1969.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 311 (Robert William); IH 2: 377; Kew 3: 294;
Roon p. 62.
Selling, O., Sv. bot. Tidskr. 56(1): 203-222. 1962 (portr., bibl.); Nova Hedwigia 4: 275-298.
	1962 (portr., bibl.).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Drygalski, E. v., (edit.), <em>Deutsche Südpolar-Expedition</em> 1901-1903, with
H. Herden, <em>Die marinen Diatomeen der deutschen Süd-Polar-Expedition</em> 1901-1903, vol. 8: 447-715,
pl. <em>31-43</em> (1-13); Berlin, Leipzig 1928.
(2) For further composite works see the excellent, detailed bibliography of Kolbe by Selling
(1962).

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Kolbeana</em> B. V. Skvortzov (1969).

Kolenati, Friedrich August Rudolph (1812-1864), Bohemian zoologist and botanist at

HEADING: KOLENATI

<sm>NOTE</sm>: The second christian name is also given as "Anton"; for the year of birth we follow the
transcription of the text on the tombstone as shown by the illustration in Nemec 1964, which
mentions 12 Aug 1812 (not 1813) as the birth date. This tombstone was erected in 1867 (see
also Melion (1866)).

	<em>Index to vols. 1-4</em>: 14 Mai 1936, p. [ii]-vi, [1]-128.

These dates are those of official approval for publication. Actual availability may have been
up to 25 days later (Kirpicznikov) (see for instance the dates of the addenda). An alphabeti-
cal list of the names of authors of taxa dealt with in vols. 1-30 was published on 29 Aug 1964
by L. I. Ivanina, T. G. Leonova and A. E. Macenko as Flora SSSR, Index alphabeticus
auctorum ad taxa adductorum (also with Russian title), Moskwa, Leningrad 1964. Kirpic-
znikov mentions an oral communication by E. G. Bobrov that the first 6 volumes were
reprinted in facsimile without the knowledge and consent of the editors. The first volume
(1000 copies) of this reprint appeared on 14 Sep 1937. The reprint of the second volume (850
copies) was published possibly in 1934. It is not definitely known, however, whether reprints
were made of volumes 3 through 6.
	A second printing of volume 11 (originally 1941, 500 copies) took place from the original
type in 1945 (publ. 23 July 1945, copies 501-4000).
	For extensive details on this Flora see Kirpicznikov (1967); for further bibliographical
details and a listing of the collaborators see Linczevski (1966).

INSTITUTUM BOTANICUM ACADEMIAE SCIENTIARUM URSS
<em>FLORA
URSS</em>

SOVIETICARUM SOCIALISTICARUM)</em>
I
<em>Redactore ac. V. L. KOMAROV</em>
EDITIO ACADEMIAE SCIENTIARUM URSS LENINGRAD. 1931

used by the authors of TL-2 as worksheet for their annotations.

Konrad, Paul (1877-1948), Swiss geometrician; amateur mycologist and botanical artist at
Neuchâtel, from 1902 with the Compagnie des Tramways de Neuchâtel, director 1938-1948;
Dr. sci. h.c. Neuchâtel 1932. (<em>Konrad</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Konrad's mycological drawings are at NEU.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 313; Kew 3: 296; LS suppl. 14596-14636;
Stevenson p. 1247.
Becker, Rev. mycol. 14(1) suppl.: 1-4. 1949.
Gillard, Natural, beiges 30(2): 33. 1949.
Maublanc, Bull. Soc. mycol. France 67: 329-335. 1951 (portr.).
Mayor, Bull. Soc. neuch. Sci. nat. 72: 217-222. 1949 (portr., bibl.).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: With A. Maublanc: <em>Les Agaricales</em>. Classification. Révision des espèces.
Iconographie. Comestibilité. I. Agaricaceae <em>Encyclopédie mycologique</em> 14, Paris 1948, 469 p.; II
Russulacées 1952.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: The etymology of <em>Konradia</em> Raciborski (1900) could not be established.

3858. <em>Icones selectae fungorum</em> ... Paris (Paul Lechevalier ...) 1924-1937, 6 vols. Qu. (<em>Icon.
select. fung.</em>).

	<em>3</em>: [i*-iii*], [i]-vi, <em>pl. 200-299</em>, id.

PAGE: 645
HEADING: KOORDERS

Koorders, Sijfert Hendrik (1863-1919), Dutch-Indonesian forester and botanist at
Buitenzorg (Bogor); Dr. phil. Bonn 1897; in the Dutch East Indian Forest Service from 1885
stationed in Java; from 1892-1903 and 1910-1919 working at BO. (<em>Koord</em>.)

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BO (40.000), duplicates: A, B, BR, CAL, G, GRO, K, L, P, PNH, U,
UC.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 306; Barnhart 2: 313; BJI 1: 33, 2: 93; BL 1: 104,
105, 111, 112, 113, 304; BM 2: 1016; Bossert p. 217; CSP 16: 415; GR p. 706-707; Hortus 3:
1197 ("Koord."); IH 2: 379; JW 1: 445, 2: 194, 3: 357; Kew 3: 297; Lenley p. 253; LS
14299u, 35555-35559, suppl. 14640; NI 1090-1901; Rehder 5: 468; SK 1: xxxi, 292-294;
Tucker 1: 397-398, 776-777.
Anon., Bot. Not. 1920: 126; Nuova Notarisia 32: 72. 1921; Tijdschr. k. Ned. aardrijksk.
	Genootsch. ser. 2. 37: 118. 1920.
Brascamp, Tectona 13: 377-504. 1920 (bibl., portr.).
Bruinsma, Tectona 5: 895-906. 1912.
Docters van Leeuwen, Bull. Jard. bot. Buitenzorg ser. 2. 2(3): 237-241. 1920 (portr.); De
	tropische Natuur 8(12): 127. Dec 1919.
Lindau, <em>in</em> S. H. Koorders, Fl. Tjibodas 1(2): v-vi. 1922.
Moll, Ned. kruidk. Arch. 1919: 73-76. 1920.
Sirks, M. J., Indisch Natuurond. 299 [index]. 1915.
Went, F. A. F. C., Tijdschr. k. Ned. aardrijksk. Genootsch. ser. 2. 37: 240-244. 1920.

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Fl. males. ser. I. 1: cl. 1950.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Koordersiella</em> von Höhnel (1909); <em>Koordersina</em> O. Kuntze (1903); <em>Koordersiochloa</em>
Merill (1917); <em>Koordersiodendron</em> Engler (1898).

3860. <em>Zakflora voor Java</em>. Sleutel tot de geslachten en familien der woudboomen van Java,..
Batavia en Noordwijk (Ernst &amp; Co.) 1893. Oct. (<em>Zakfl. Java</em>).

Th. Valeton, ... Additamenta ad cognitionem florae javanicae ... [1-4:] Batavia –
'sGravenhage, [5-13:] Batavia (G. Kolff &amp; Co.) 1894 [-1914]. Oct. (<em>Bijdr. boomsoort. Java</em>).

	(1867-1947).

	[Med.].

Kops, Jan (1765-1849), Dutch agronomist and botanist, professor of botanyat Utrecht.(<em>Kops</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: NBV. – Many originals of the later plates of the <em>Flora batava</em> at L.

(Beck von Mannagetta) Beck von Mannagetta (1930).

Kornhuber, (Georg) Andreas (von) (Korn-Huber) (1825-1905), Austrian botanist at the
polytechnical school at Vienna; Dr. med. vindob. 1850; teacher at the Oberrealschule
Pressburg [Bratislava] 1852-1861; professor of botany and zoology at the k.k. polytech-
nisches Institut Wien (now Polytechnical University) 1861-1895; at Pressburg 1897-1905;
died in Wien. (<em>Kornh</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. Some material at LE, SLO (partly destroyed).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 314; BJI 1: 33; BM 2: 1017; Bossert p. 218; CSP

Korshinsky [Koržinskij], Sergei Iwanowitsch (1861-1900), Russian botanist; Dr. Phil.
Kasan 1888, professor of botany at Tomsk 1888-1892, botanist at the botanical garden in St.
Petersburg 1892-1900; traveller in Siberia and Turkestan; outstanding plant geographer.
(<em>Korshinsky</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LE. – Exsiccatae: (a) <em>Herbarium florae rossicae</em>, nos. 1-200, 1898; sets at

Koster, Joséphine Thérèse (1902-x), Dutch botanist at the Rijksherbarium, Leiden
1930-1967; Ph.D. Leiden 1935; worked on Malaysian Compositae, Cyanophyta and marine
algae. (<em>J. Kost.</em>).

Kostermans, André Joseph Guillaume Henri (1907-x), Dutch botanist; trained at
Utrecht; Ph.D. 1936, settled at Buitenzorg, later Bogor, Indonesia; explorer and taxonomist
(Lauraceae) connected with the Forest Research Institute. (<em>Kosterm</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BO and BZF. For collections and itineraries see IH and SK.

("Kosterm."); IH 2: 381-382; Kew 3: 302-303; Langman p. 417; MW suppl. p. 178-179;

Anon., Taxon 1: 135. 1952.

	Bernardi).

Kotschy, Carl (Karl) Georg Theodor (1813-1866), Austrian botanical explorer of the
Orient 1835-1843; from 1847 assistant, from 1852 curator of the herbarium of the Vienna
Natural History Museum (W). (<em>Kotschy</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: W; important material also at BP. – For detailed information on
travels and collections see IH. Total number of specimens collected over 300.000. For
identifications of K's plants distributed by the Esslingen Society see Flora 1842 Beibl. 9: 129-
149, 1842(2): 416-424, 1843: 473-476, 489-498, 1844: 241-254, and also Schweinfurth, <em>Beitr.
Fl. Äthiopiens</em> (1867). Many of K's plants were also described in Boissier, <em>Fl. orient</em>. K's diaries
of the period 1835-1843 are lost.
For <em>Reliquiae Kotschyanae</em> see no. 3895.
<em>Ref</em>.: Anon., Bot. Zeit. 26: 655. 1868 (herb. bought by Haynald).
	Baur, Jahrb. Gesch. oberdeut. Reichsstädte 16: 234, 236, 254-255. 1970 (on K's material
	distr. by Esslingen Society).
	Miller, H. S., Taxon 19: 528. 170.
	Hedge, I. C. and Lamond, J. M., Ind. coll. Edinburgh 99. 1970.
	Kukkonen, I., Herb. Christian Steven 63. 1971.
	Steinberg, C., Webbia 32(1): 29. 1977.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>; ADB 16: 763-764; AG 2(1): 707-708, 12(3): 657; Backer p.
307; Barnhart 2: 315; BL 1: 32, 305; BM 2: 1019; Bossert p. 218; Clokie p. 195; CSP 3: 738,
8: 115; DTS 1: 160, 6(4): 32; Frank 3(Anh.): 53; GR p. 436, cat. p. 66; Hortus 3: 1197
("Kotschy"); IH 2: 382-383; Jackson p. 568 [index]; Kanitz 218; Kew 3: 304, Klášterský p.
112; Langman p. 417; Lasègue p. 117, 574 [index]; LS 14332; NI 1093-1095; PR 4835-4843

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Kotschya</em> Endlicher (1839).

PAGE: 656
HEADING: KOTSCHY

3887. <em>Abbildungen und Beschreibungen neuer und seltener Thiere und Pflanzen in Syrien</em> und im
westlichen Taurus gesammelt von Th. Kotschy. Herausgegeben von den D.D. Fenzl, Heckel
&amp; Redtenbacher. Stuttgart (E. Schweizerbart'sche Verlaghandlung) 1843. Oct., Fol. (<em>Ab-
bild. Thiere Pfl. Syr.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1843, in three independently paged parts of which the first, by Fenzl, deals with plants
	and those by L. Redtenbacher (part 2) with Coleoptera (20 p., <em>2 pl</em>.), and by J. J. Heckel
	(part 3) with fishes (258 p., <em>3 pl</em>.).
<em>General t.p.</em> and identification: p. [i-ii], [i] as above, [ii]: "Abgedruckt aus Russegger's
	Reisen. I. Band, 2. Theil." Actually the book is a reprint with new t.p.'s and pagination
	from Russegger's "<em>Reisen in Enropa, Asien</em>, ..." 1(2) and 2(3), also provided with the
	original running pagination.
<em>Botany</em> (= part 1): <em>Illustrationes et descriptiones plantarum novarum Syriae et Tauri occidentalis</em>
	auctore Eduardo Fenzl [Eduard Fenzl (1808-1879)], ... Stuttgart (id.) 1843. Oct., p.
	[iii]-viii, [1]-84, [1-2, index] (running pagination:p. vi = 884, 1-84 = 887-970). <em>Copy</em>:
	Teyler.
<em>Plates</em>: no t.p., <em>pl. 1-20</em> (uncol. liths. by Dr. Bill). Fol. <em>Copy</em>: Teyler.– For details on Joseph von
	Russegger (1802-1863) and his <em>Reisen</em> (1841-1849), see BM 4: 1768-1769.

Ueberreuter) 1853. Oct. (<em>Beitr. Alpenland. Siebenbürgen</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1853, p. [1]-32. <em>Copy</em>: MO. – Reprinted from Verh. k.k. zool.-bot. Ver. Wien 3: 57-69,
	131-140, 271-277. 1853.

3889. <em>Allgemeiner Ueberblick der Nilländer und ihrer Pflanzenbekleidung</em> [Wien 1857]. 16-mo. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1857, p. [1]-26. <em>Copy</em>: MO. – Reprinted and to be cited from Mitt. k.k. geogr. Ges.
	1(2): 156-182. 1857; see also Bonplandias: 174-180. 1857. – For further references to K's
	publications on the vegetation of the Nile region see Baur (1970), p. 254-255, note 73.
<em>Ref</em>.: Schlechtendal, D. F. L. von, Bot. Zeit. 16: 91-92. 22 Apr 1858.

3890. <em>Die Eichen Europa's und des Orients</em>. Gesammelt, zum Theil neu entdeckt und mit
Hinweisung auf ihre Culturfähigkeit für Mittel-Europa &amp;c. beschrieben von Dr. Theodor
Kotschy ... 40 Foliotafeln ausgeführt in Oel-Farbendruck mit erläuterndem Text in
deutscher, französischer und lateinischer Sprache. Wien und Olrnüz (Eduard Hölzel's
Verlag) [1858-] 1862. Fol. (<em>Eich. Eur. Orient.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: in 8 parts, p. [i]-viii, <em>pl. 1-40</em> with text.
	The copy at G is in original covers (with year dates):

	<em>1</em>: 1858, <em>pl. 1-5, with text</em>.
	<em>2</em>: 1859 (Flora rd. 14 Apr 1859), <em>pl. 6, 8-10</em>, without text.
	<em>3</em>: 1859 (Flora rd. 14 Nov 1859), <em>pl. 7, 11-15</em>, without text, but with text for <em>pl. 6-10.</em>
	<em>4</em>: 1859 (Flora rd. 14 Nov. 1859), <em>pl. 16-20</em>, id., with text for <em>11-15</em>.
	<em>5</em>: 1860, <em>pl. 21-25</em>, id- with text for <em>16-25</em>.

	<em>7/8</em>: Jun 1862, <em>pl. 31-40</em>, with text, p. [i]-viii, ticket with note dated Jun 1862, prospectus.

<em>Copies</em>: B, BR, G, NY, USDA. – <em>French t.p</em>.: <em>Illustrations des chênes de l'Europe et d'Orient. – Plates</em>:
	colour-printed, J. Seboth del., Oberer.

3894. <em>Plantae tinneanae</em> sive descriptio plantarum in expeditione tinneana ad flumen Bahl-el-
Ghasal eiusque affluentias in septentrionali interioris Africae parte collectarum. Opus xxvii
tabulis exornatum Theodori Kotschy et Ioannis Peyritsch consociatis studiis elaboratum suis

<em>Co-author</em>: Johann Joseph Peyritsch (1835-1889).
<em>Publ</em>.: 1867 (p.x: Jul 1867), p. [i*-xviii*], [i]-viii, [1-2], 1-54, <em>pl. 1-8, 8b, 9-14, 15a, 15b, 16-25.
	Copies</em>: MO, NY.
The 27 hand coloured <em>plates</em> are by Liepoldt and Mettenius. The book was also issued with
uncoloured plates. – Mrs. H. L. M. A. Tinne, her daughter A. P. F. Tinne and Mrs. A. van
Capellen-Tinne made a journey up the White Nile in 1861-1864. The two elder women died
during the expedition. For details and references with respect to the travels by the Tinne
family see Kanitz (1868), TL-2/3507, Eggink (1960) and Gladstone (1970).
<em>Ref</em>.: Kanitz, A., Bot. Zeit. 26: 487-498, 504-507. 1868; Flora 51: 385-398, 417-425, 433-441,
	465-472, 497-511, 523-529. 1868.
	Eggink, C., De merkwaardige reizen van Alexandrine Tinne, Amsterdam 1960.
	Gladstone, Travels of Alexine, London 1970.

3895. <em>Reliquiae Kotschyanae</em>. Beschreibung und Abbildung einer Anzahl unbeschriebener
oder wenig gekannter Pflanzenarten, welche Theodor Kotschy auf seinen Reisen in den
Jahren 1837 bis 1839 als Begleiter Joseph's von Russegger in den südlich von Kordofan und
oberhalb Fesoglu gelegenen Bergen der freien Neger gesammelt hat. Herausgegeben von Dr.
Georg Schweinfurth ... Nebst einer biographischen Skizze Theodor Kotschy's von O.
Kotschy. Mit fünf und dreissig lithographirten Tafeln und dem Bildnisse Theodor
Kotschy's. Berlin (Druck und Verlag von Georg Reimer) 1868. (<em>Reliq. Kotschy.</em>).

<em>Author of text</em>: Georg August Schweinfurth (1836-1925); <em>leader expedition</em>: Joseph von Russegger
	(1802-1863); <em>author of biography</em>: Oskar Kotschy.
<em>Publ</em>.: Jun-Dec 1868 (p. vi: 15 Mai 1868; BSbF post 27 Jan 1869); front, portr. Kotschy, p.
	[i]-xl, [1]-52, <em>pl. 1-35</em>, uncol. liths. by Liepoldt. <em>Copies</em>: MO, USDA.

Kováts von Szent-Lélek, Julius (1815-1873), Hungarian actuo- and palaeobotanist at
the Hungarian national Museum at Pest from 1850. (<em>Kováts</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BP. – Further material: B, C, CN, E, H, L, LZ, M, MANCH, W,
WAG, WRSL. Published exsiccatae: <em>Flora exsiccata vindobonensis</em>, and <em>Plantae rar. imp. Austriae</em>.
<em>Ref</em>.: Anon., Bot. Zeit. 35: 136. 1877 (herb, for sale).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 4: 212, 12(1): 487; Barnhart 2: 316; Bossert p. 219; CSP
3: 739; Hortus 3: 1197 ("Kováts"); IH 2: 383; Jackson p. 182; Kanitz 183; PR 4845-4846;
Quenstedt p. 242; WU 13: 68-70.
Anon., Flora 56: 431. 1873.
Pax, F., Grundz. Pflanzenverbr. Karpathen 1: 48. 1898 (Veg. Erde 2(1)), 2: 279. 1908 (id 8).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: A planned <em>Flora of Hungary</em> (in Hungarian), with Samuel von Brassai (1797-1897) did
not materialize because of lack of subscriptions. Parts of the manuscript were published by
Brassai in Magy. Nov. Lap. 10-12, 1886-1888, see also Linnaea 33: 595, 607. 1865. See
Kanitz (no. 183) for a brief biography and bibliography; according to this information the
title was to have been "<em>Magyar novénysme vagy</em> ..." ("Knowledge of Hungarian plants").

Kraenzlin, Friedrich (Fritz) Wilhelm Ludwig (1847-1934), German orchidologist.
(<em>Kraenzl</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Kraenzlin's herbarium was acquired by B in 1907. Kraenzlin's types
were mainly in his own herbarium. Some others are still at W, and perhaps also at K, BR and
M.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 317; BJI 1: 33, 2: 94-95; CSP 10: 457; 16: 446-
447; Hortus 3: 1197 ("Kränzl."); IH 2: 385; Kew 3: 307-308; KR p. 359; Langman p. 417-
418; LS suppl. 14799-14801; MW p. 249-250, suppl. p. 181; NI 1096; Rehder 5: 471; SK 4:
cxciv; TL-2/1: 1713; Tucker 1: 400; Urban-Berl. p. 365; Zander ed. 10, p. 680.
Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 53: 96. 1893; Rev. Hortic. belge 34: 140. 1908 (portr.); Chron. bot. 1:
	149. 1935 (portr.).
Jones, H. G., Taxon 22: 233. 1973 (portr.).
Merrill, E. D., Contr. U.S. natl. Herb. 30(1): 178-179. 1947 (bibl.).
Weberbauer, A., Pflanzenw. peruan. Anden 32. 1911 (Veg. Erde 12).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Engler, <em>Pflanzenreich</em> (TL-2/1713):
(a) <em>Scrophulariaceae</em>, Heft 28, <em>Publ</em>. 5 Apr 1907.
(b) <em>Orchidaceae</em>, Coelogyninae, with E. Pfitzer, Heft 32, <em>Publ</em>. 26 Nov 1907.
<em>Dendrobünae</em> I, Heft 45, <em>Publ</em>.: 15 Nov 1910.
<em>Dendrobünae</em> II, heft 50, <em>Publ</em>.: 17 Oct 1911.
<em>Thelasünae</em>, Heft 50, <em>Publ</em>.: 17 Oct 1911.
<em>Oncidünae</em>, Heft 80, <em>Publ</em>.: 14 Mar 1922.
<em>Pseudomonopodiales</em> Heft 83, <em>Publ</em>.: 6 Mar 1923.
(c) <em>Cannaceae</em>, Heft 56, <em>Publ</em>.: 22 Oct 1912.
(2) Continued H. G. Reichenbach, <em>Xenia orchidacea</em>.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: × <em>Kraenzlinara</em> L. A. Garay &amp; H. R. Sweet (1966); <em>Kraenzlinella</em> O. Kuntze (1903).

Kraepelin, Karl (earlier publ.: Carl) [Mathias Friedrich] (1848-1915), German bo-
tanist and zoologist; Dr. phil. Leipzig 1872; from 1873-1874 high school teacher at Leipzig;
from 1878-1889 at the Hamburg Johanneum; from 1889-1914 director of the natural history
museum at Hamburg. (<em>Kraep</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: HBG. – The collections from the 1904 trip to the East Indies at M.

	Kraepelin's diary of his brother's journey to India and Java in 1904). (portr.), (Emil

Kräusel, Richard (1890-1966), German palaebotanist; Dr. phil. Breslau 1913 (with F. A.
Pax); high school teacher at Frankfurt from 1920; professor of palaeobotany 1928; from 1939
director of the palaebotanical department of the Senckenberg Musuem; Dr. h.c. Durham
1963; student of the Devonian and the Central European mesozoic flora. (<em>Kräus</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: FR (Devonian collections destroyed during World War II).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Andrews p. 290-291; Barnhart 2: 317; BFM 1366; BJI 2: 95;
Bossert p. 219; Hirsch p. 160; Kew 3: 308-309; Langman p. 418; LS suppl. 14802-14806;
MW p. 250; NI 1096n; TL-2/1: 1711.
Banks, H. P. Phytomorphology 18(1): 178-179. 1968.
Dilcher, Plant Sci. Bull. 13(1): 8. 1967.
Edwards, Palaeontographica 92B(3-6): 53-62. 1952.
Mertens und Schmidt, Natur und Volk 90(8/9): 295-297. 1960 (portr.).

Krasser, Fridolin (1863-1922), Austrian botanist and palaeobotanist; Dr. phil. Wien
1887; from 1887 in various functions in Wien, e.g. assistant at the Naturh. Museum 1896-
1902; 1901-1906 at the ?nologisch-pomologischen Lehranstalt in Klosterneuburg; from
1906-1922 professor of botany at the technical university of Praha. (<em>Krasser</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. Some material at H, LE, W. – Krasser prepared a
palaeobotanical atlas for which many of the plates were ready by the time of his death.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Andrews p. 289-290; Backer p. 307; Barnhart 2: 318; BJI 1:

Anon., Nat. Nov. 1923: 383; Nature 111: 57-58. 1923.

tenbach near Kassel 1908-1913; later at Kassel, from 1923-1951 as high school teacher at the
middle school for boys. (<em>Krasske</em>).

Kraus, Gregor Konrad Michael (1841-1915), German physiological botanist; Dr. phil.
Würzburg 1866; from 1866-1867 at Bonn as pupil of J. Sachs; 1867-1869 "Privatdozent" at
Würzburg; 1868-1869 at Leipzig; 1869-1873 professor of botany at Erlangen; 1872-1898
idem at Halle succeeding de Bary; from 1898-1914 idem at Würzburg succeeding Julius
Sachs. (<em>Kraus</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: WB (destroyed).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart, 2: 318; BFM 364, 3031; BJI 1: 34; BM 2: 1024;
Bossert p. 219; CSP 8: 120-121, 10: 459-460, 16: 456-457; De Toni 1: lxxii, 2: lxxiii; Frank
3(Anh.): 53; GR p. 101; IH 2: 385; Jackson p. 568 [index]; Kew 3: 312; LS suppl. 14826;
Moebius p. 199, 452; Quenstedt p. 244; Rehder 5: 472-473; TL-2/1: 866; Tucker 1: 400;
Zander ed. 10, p. 680.
Anon., Bot. Not. 1916: 47.

3914. <em>Der botanische Garten der Universität Halle</em>. Leipzig (Wilhelm Engelmann) 1888-1894, 2
Hefte. Oct. (<em>Bot. Gart. Halle</em>).

<em>Copy</em>: U. – Important historical study on the history of botany at Halle, but especially also on
the history of plant introduction into Western Europe. Much biographical and bibliographi-
cal information on K. P. J. Sprengel and his pupils.

Krause, Ernst Hans Ludwig (1859-1942), German physician and botanist; Dr. med.
Berlin 1881; prolific batologist; longtime "Oberstabarzt" at Saarlouis; later in Rostock. (<em>E.
H. L. Krause</em>).

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Krauseola</em> Pax &amp; Hoffmann (1934) may be dedicated to him ("... zu Ehren von
Johannes Krause ..."). <em>Krauseella</em> C. Müller Hal. (1883) is dedicated to the brothers Aurel
Krause (1848-1908) and Arthur Krause (1851-1920), German geographers and botanical
collectors.

3923. <em>Das Getreide-Buch</em>, oder neueste Wanderungen durch das wissenschaftliche Gebiet der
Getreide. Ein Hülfswerk für Alle, die eine genaue Kenntniss der bis jetzt bekannten
Getreidearten, Systeme und verschiedenen Benennungen (Synonimik), wie auch der dem
Getreide schädlichen Unkräuter, Krankheiten und Feinde, der hierzu erforderlichen Lite-
ratur und noch mancherlei anderes Wissenswerthe über diesen Gegenstand bedürfen oder
wünschen, von Johann Wilhelm Krause, ... Mit mehrern in den Text eingedruckten und
beigegebenen Holzschnitten, nebst einem vollständigen Register über die deutschen Namen
der Unkräuter. Auch als Kommentar zu desselben Verfassers grossem Werke: Abbildungen
und Besehreibung aller bis jetzt bekannten Getreidearten (8 Hefte royal Folio), zu be-
trachten. Leipzig (Baumgärtner's Buchhandlung) 1840. Oct. (<em>Getreide-Buch</em>).

	(inf. W. Gutermann).

Krauss, Christian Ferdinand Friedrich von (1812-1890), German botanist and
zoologist; Dr. Phil. Heidelberg 1836; travelled in South Africa 1838-1840; from 1840 in
various functions at the natural history museum at Stuttgart. (<em>C. Krauss</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> AND <sm>TYPES</sm>: NO original botanical material in STU; specimens of his South
African plants are in many herbaria (see IH); HBG and OXF have original algae;
bryophytes at FI and LY. – We are grateful to Ernst Schüz at Stuttgart for information on
Krauss' collections and travelogues.

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: MICH (with Kelly's library and collections). Botanical paintings

Krombach, Johann Heinrich Wilhelm (1791-1881), German-born Luxemburg bo-
tanist and pharmacist; assistant pharmacist at Soest (1810-1811), Mainz (1811-1813),
Aachen (1814-1815); pharmacist at Diekirch, Luxemburg 1815-1870; Luxemburg citizen
1830; professor of natural sciences Diekirch 1830-1870, at Luxemburg 1871-1881. (<em>Kromb</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown (no material at BR).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 322; BFM 286; BL 2: 419, 677; BM 2: 1028;
Bossert p. 220; Jackson p. 273; Maiwald p. 279; Stevenson p. 1248; Tucker 1: 402.
Anon., Bull. Soc. bot. France 19(bibl.): 157. 1875 (founding Luxemburg bot. Soc).
Kintgen, Rec. Soc. bot. Luxemburg 6-8: 96-100. [ca. 1881] (portr.).

3958. <em>Flore du Grand-Duché de Luxembourg</em>. Plantes phanerogames ... Luxembourg (Impri-
merie J. Joris) 1875. Duod. (in sixes). (<em>Fl. Luxembourg</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1875 (p. [iv]: 20 Mai 1875; Bot. Zeit. 3 Mar 1876). p. [i-vi], [1]-564. <em>Copy</em>: USDA. –
	Describes 1353 spermatophytes.
<em>Ref</em>.: Anon., Bot. Zeit. 34: 144. 1876.

Krombholz, Julius Vincenz von (1782-1843), Czech mycologist; Dr. med. Erfurt 1811;
1811-1814 prosector, from 1814 professor of theoretical surgery, from 1820-1836 "Professor
der Staatsarzneikunde" at Praha. (<em>Krombh</em>.)

PAGE: 679
HEADING: KROMBHOLZ

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>NAME</sm>: Baptized Vincenz Krombholz; assumed the name Julius in later years. – Born 19 Dec
1782 in Politz, Bohemia; died 2 Nov 1843, Praha.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Ainsworth p. 70, 226, 295, 314; Barnhart 2: 322; BM 2:
1028; Bossert p. 220; CSP 3: 757; Frank 3(Anh.): 53; Jackson p. 268; Kew 3: 317; Lasègue p.
545; LS 14451-14454; Maiwald p. 279; NAF 9(6): 40; NI 1106; PR 4897-4898 (ed. 1: 5422-
5423); Rehder 5: 475; Stevenson p. 1248.
Anon., Bot. Not. 1844: 96; Bot. Zeit. 2: 271-273. 5 Apr 1844; Flora 27: 256. 1844; Portraiten-
	Gallerie berühmter Aerzte und Naturforscher des österreichischen Kaiserthumes, Wien
	1838, p. 13 (portr.).
Bolzano, Abh. k. böhm. Ges. Wiss. ser. 5.4: 9-51. 1847 (bibl.; main biogr.).
Pritzel, G. A., Linnaea 19: 456. 1847.
Wittrock, V. B., Acta Horti Berg. 3(2): 83. 1903.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: Krombholzia Ruprecht ex E. P. N. Fournier (1876); <em>Krombholzia</em> P. A. Karsten
(1881); <em>Krombholziella</em> R. Maire (1937).

3959. <em>Conspectus fungorum esculentorum</em>, qui per decursum anni 1820 Pragae publice vende-
bantur. Momentum topographicum. Programma in collegia medicinae publicae primi
senestris in Universitate Carolo-Ferdinandea ... Uibersicht [sic] der essbaren Schwämme,
welche in Verlaufe des Jahres 1820 in Prag zu Markte gebracht wurden. Eine topogra-
phische Notiz als Programm zur Eröffnung der Vorlesungen über Staatsarzneikunde an der
Karl-Ferdinand-Universität im Schuljahre 1820/21 ... Prag (Bei Friedrich Tempsky,
Firma: J. G. Calve) 1820. Oct. (<em>Consp. fung. escul</em>.).

<em>Ed. 1</em>: Nov-Dec 1820 (p. 6: 1 Nov 1820), p. [1]-38. <em>Copy</em>: HBG. – The existence of this
	apparently very rare first issue of 1820 makes this title definitely pre-starting point with
	respect to Fries, <em>Syst. myc</em>. (starting point book for "Fungi caeteri" ICBN Art. 13f).
<em>Reissue</em>: 1821 (t.p. same, incl "Uibersicht" but dated 1821), p. [1]-40. <em>Copies</em>: FH, L, NY,
	Stevenson, USDA; IDC 5094.
<em>Facsimile reprint</em>: announced 1977 by Boerhaave Press (Taxon 26: 256).
<em>Ref</em>.: Petersen, Mycotaxon 1: 156. 1975 (had not seen 1820 original).

3960. <em>Naturgetreue Abbildungen und Beschreibungen der</em> essbaren, schädlichen und verdächtigen
<em>Schwämme</em> ... Erstes [-Zehntes (letztes)] Heft. Prag (In Commission in der J. G. Calve'schen
Buchhandlung) 1831-1846, 10 parts text and atlas. Fol. (<em>Naturgetr. Abbild. Schwämme</em>).

<em>Text</em>: In ten parts, for contents and dates see below.
<em>Atlas</em>: "<em>Tafeln zu dem mykologischen Werke von Krombholz</em> ... " Prag (id.). s.n. with 76 liths.
	(issued hand-coloured and plain), nos. <em>1-76, 22</em> misnumbered "<em>30</em>", <em>52</em> idem "<em>41</em>", 57 idem
	"<em>52</em>".
<em>Copies</em>: B (uncol.), G, L (col.), MICH, NY, Stevenson, U, USDA.

Heft	text	plates	dates
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
1	[i]-x, [1-2, err.], [1]-85	1-6	Sep-Dec 1831

10	[1]-28, [1-6, ind.; 1, err.]	71-76	1846

Baptista Zobel (1821-1865) may have been editor of parts 8-10.

HEADING: KRONFELD

Kronfeld, Ernst Moriz (1865-1942), Austro-Hungarian botanist; born at Lemberg
(Lwow); editor of the Vienna <em>Fremdenblatt</em>. (<em>Kronf</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 323; BJI 1: 35, 2: 97; BM 2: 1028; CSP 16: 478-
479; De Toni 1: lxxii, 2: lxxiii; DTS 1: 161-162; Kew 3: 318; Langman p. 419; LS 14455-
14456, 35619-35620, suppl. 14912; MW p. 252; Rehder 5: 475; Tucker 1: 402.
Dolezal, H., Friedrich Welwitsch 104, 108. 1974.
Urban, I., Fl. Bras. 1(1): 182-183. 1906 (orig. biogr. inf.).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) EP, <em>Die natürlichen Pflanzenfamilien</em>, ed. 1, <em>Aquifoliaceae</em>, III. 5: 183-189,
<em>publ</em>.: Dec 1892. (Nachträge by Loesener, Th., <em>in</em> Nachtr. 2-4 (1): 217-221. Oct 1897. (TL-
	2/1710).
(2) Martius, <em>Flora brasiliensis, Typhaceae</em>, 3(3): 635-642, <em>pl. 115</em>. 15 Apr 1894.
<sm>NOTE</sm>: Kronfeld's important collection of biographies is at W. K. died at Lemberg (Lwow) on
16 Mar 1942 (inf. H. Riedl).

Krüger, Ernst (1860-1942), German bryologist at Eisenach; high school teacher at
Sunnabei Vacha 1880-1897; at Eisenach 1897-1924. (<em>E. Krüger</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: JE ("eines der schönsten und saubersten Moosherbarien, die ich
kenne ..." K. Mägdefrau in litt.). – We are grateful to Prof. Mägdefrau for drawing our
attention to Krüger and his <em>Moosflora</em>.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 323; BFM 3238; LS suppl. 14923-14924.
Mägdefrau, K., Hercynia 3(7/8): 345. 1944 (intr. to K's <em>Moosflora</em>).

3961. Die Moosflora der Umgebung von Eisenach, <em>Hercynia</em> 3(7/8): 345-413. 1944.
<em>Publ</em>.: 1944; posthumously published by Karl Mägdefrau. <em>Copy</em>: FAS (reprint with original
	pagination and portrait of Krüger). Krüger, Marcus Salomonides (<em>fl. 1841</em>), German bibliographer. (<em>M. Krüger</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BM 2: 1030; Jackson p. 2; Kew 3: 318; PR 4902 (ed. 1: 5426-
5427); Rehder 5: 475; SO 849a, 3654; Tucker 1: 402.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Kruegera</em> W. Heering 1906 is dedicated to Wilhelm Krueger (1857-x), German
phytopathologist.

3962. <em>Bibliographia botanica</em>. Handbuch der botanischen Literatur in systematischer Ord-
nung nebst kurzen biographischen Notizen über die botanischen Schriftsteller. Zum Ge-
brauche für Freunde und Lehrer der Pflanzenkunde ... Berlin (Haude und Spenersche
Buchhandlung (S. J. Joseephy.)) 1841. Oct. (<em>Bibl. bot</em>.).

<em>Publ</em>.: Feb-Apr 1841 (p. iv: Feb 1841; announcement in Flora 1841: before Ostermesse), p.
	[i]-vi, [11-464. <em>Copies</em>: G, MO, NY, U; IDC 6496. – Systematically arranged. Based
	mainly on the holdings of the Berlin libraries at the time.

Krug, Carl Wilhelm Leopold (1833-1898), German botanist, businessman and consular
official; in Puerto Rico 1857-1876; later working with I. Urban on a flora of the West Indies.
(<em>Krug</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> AND <sm>TYPES</sm>: B; duplicates, C, CORD, G, L, SI. (Berlin received the West Indian
Krug und Urban collections from 1891 onward). For his manuscript Flora portoricensis and
Catalogus plantarum omnium Indiae orientalis e.a. see Urban 1898, (no longer extant).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 308; Barnhart 2: 323; BJI 1: 35; Bossert p. 221;

HEADING: KUCKUCK

Kuckuck, Ernst Herman Paul (1866-1918), German algologist; Dr. phil. Kiel 1891;
with Reinke at Kiel 1888-1892; at the Helgoland biological station 1892-1914; from 1914-
1918 at Berlin as a guest at the Dahlem Botanical Museum. (<em>Kuck</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B, (mostly destroyed) KIEL and Biol. Anstalt Helgoland. Some
duplicates at C and HBG. Kuckuck laid the foundation for the now destroyed herbarium at
Helgoland.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 324; BJI 2: 98; BM 2: 1031; CSP 16: 492; De

Kühn, Julius Gotthelf (1825-1910), German phytopathologist at Halle, Preussischer

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some material at PAV. – S. Rauschert, to whom we are grateful for

much information on Kühn, informs us that there is no material at HAL. The "Julius-Kühn-

Kükenthal, Georg (1864-1955), German clergyman and botanist at Grub a. F. and, from
1919, Coburg; ordained Coburg 1885; Dr. phil. h.c. Breslau 1913; long-time associate for
Cyperaceae of Engler and the Botanical Museum, Berlin-Dahlem. (<em>Kükenth</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B; further material at BR, C, E, GB, H, LE, MOD. – The original
<em>Carex</em> herbarium was presented to B before 1940 and is destroyed. However, his general
herbarium and the collections privately kept, came to B in 1944, including his important
collections of Cyperaceae (excl. Carex) and Rubus.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 2(2): 73, 12(3): 201; Barnhart 2: 325; BFM 871; BJI 1:
35, 2: 98; Bossert p. 222; CSP 16: 496; DTS 1: 162, 6(4): 165; IH 2: 394; Kew 3: 326; KR p.
360; Langman p. 420; MW p. 254, suppl. p. 185; NW p. 50; PFC 2(2):xxii; Rehder 5: 476;
TL-2/1: 1713; Zander ed. 10, p. 681.
Anon., Bol. Soc. Argent. Bot. 7(1): 53. 1957; Bull. Geogr. bot. 23: 2-4. 1913 (portr., bibl.);
	Generalregister Bot. Not. 1839-1938: 103-104. 1939.
Collander, R. et al., Bibl. Bot. fenn. 1901-1950: 272. 1973.
Goulding, Rec. Auckland Inst. Mus. 12: 117-118. 1975 (contacts with Cheeseman).
Gunckel, Rev. Universitaria, Chile 43: 9-11. 1958.
Koyama, J. Japan bot. 31 (2): 55. 1956.

	niedergeschrieben, manuscript at B, written 1940-1941, with additions until 1954.
Mackenzie, Torreya 9: 230-232. 1909 (rev. <em>Pflanzenreich</em> Heft 38).

Kützing, Friedrich Traugott (Kuetzing) (1807-1893), German algologist; Dr. phil.
Marburg 1837; teacher at Nordhausen (1835-1883). (<em>Kütz</em>.)

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: General herbarium of algae: L (29.247 specimens acquired by
Suringar in 1872, since 1934 at L), B (algae herbarium of the years 1872-1893, acquired in
1894, 6461 specimens, no types, now destroyed). Type collections of diatoms in AWH and
BM. Several series of exsiccatae in many herbaria e.g.: <em>Algarum aquae dulcis Germaniae</em>
[Germanicarum], dec. i-xvi, Halle 1833-1836, nos. 1-160. Sets see IH (with text; see 3969).
The types of taxa described by Kützing from the Sonder herbarium are at MEL. Kützing's
library was dispersed by sale. Copies of the plates of the <em>Phycologia generalis</em> with notes and
drawings by K. at FH.

HEADING: KÜTZING

3969. <em>Algarum aquae dulcis germanicarum</em> collegit Fridericus Traugott Kützing ... Halis

Decades	numbers	dates	notes in Flora
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1-2	1-20	Jan-Feb 1833	16: 144. 7 Mar 1833
3-4	21-40	1833, prob. Apr-Mai	id. (ann.)
5-6	41-60	Sep-Oct 1833	16: 691-701. 28 Nov 1833

13-16	121-160	Feb 1836	19(Intell. 1): 16. 1836

Complete <em>copies</em> e.g. at AWH, B, BM, C, FH(2), G, HAL, L, LD, LG, NY, PC, S. Small
octavo paper-bound booklets, with a title-page and 1-2 pages of text; the specimens one to a
page. See also Lagerstedt (1884), cited above.
<em>Ref</em>.: Kützing, F. T., Linnaea 8: 74. 1833.

3976. <em>Die Sophisten und Dialektiker</em>; die gefärlichsten Feinde der Wissenschaftlichen Botanik.

	Answer to Schleiden's polemic attack in Schelling's und Hegel's Verhältniss zur Natur-

3977. <em>Phycologia germanica</em>, d.i. Deutschlands Algen in bündigen Beschreibungen. Nebst
einer Anleitung zum Untersuchen und Bestimmen dieser Gewächse für Anfänger ...
Nordhausen (Zu finden bei Wilh. Köhne) 1845. Oct. (<em>Phycol. germ</em>.).

<em>Publ</em>.: 14-16 Aug 1845 (p. viii: 1 Mai 1845; Bot. Zeit. 5 Sep 1845; Gersdorf 19 Sep 1845;
	Hinrichs 14-16 Aug 1945; dedication 1 Mai 1845), p. [i]-x, [1]-340 ("240"). <em>Copies</em>: FH
	(author's copy on proof sheets with annotations), G, MICH, MO, NY, U, USDA.
<em>Ref</em>.: Schlechtendal, D. F. L. von, Bot. Zeit. 3: 603-604. 1845.

3978. <em>Tabulae phycologicae</em> oder Abbildungen der Tange. Nordhausen (gedruckt auf Kosten
des Verfassers (In Commission bei Wilhelm Köhne)) 1846-1857, 19 vols. Qu. (<em>Tab.phycol</em>.).

<em>Publ</em>.: In nineteen volumes of 100 plates each; all lithographs drawn by the author. The first
	two volumes were issued in fascicles of 10-50 plates; from vol. 3 (1853) onward all parts
	were half-volumes with 50 plates each. In volume 1-7 almost each tenth plate is dated,
	from vol. 8 onward, all plates are dated. These dates are <em>not</em> dates of publication; the
	respective parts were published at a somewhat later date than the one appearing on the
	last plate. There were two "editions," one with coloured plates (coloured by Kützing
	himself, sold at 2 Thlr per 10 plates), the other with plain plates (1 Thlr/10 plates). These
	prices were high even at the time of publication and relatively few copies were sold. The
	book is very rare.

Kufferath, Hubert (1882-1957), Belgian algologist and bacteriologist; Dr. sci. Bruxelles
1910; from 1904-1920 at the Institut Pasteur du Brabant; from 1920-1947 director of the
Institut Meurice-Chimie in Bruxelles. (<em>Kuff</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and TYPES: Diatoms and possibly other collections at BRLU.
<em>Ref</em>.: Wornardt, W. W., Int. direct, diatom. 34. 1968.
	Koster, J. T., Taxon 18: 554. 1969.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 325; Hirsch p. 164; IH 2: 393; LS 35673, suppl.
15140-15146; Plesch p. 293.
Allorge et Hamel [ed.], Rev. algol. ser. 2. 4(2): 75-82. 1958 (portr., bibl.).
Hauman, L., Bull. Soc. Bot. Belg. 91(1): 5-6. 1958.
Van Meel, Bull. Inst. r. Sci. nat. Belgique 35(1): 1-7. 1958 (portr., bibl.).

Kuhl, Heinrich (1796-1821), Dutch botanical and zoological explorer in the Netherlands
East-Indies; member of the "Natuurwetenschappelijke Commissie". (<em>Kuhl</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BO, L, NBV.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 308; BM 2: 1033; Bossert p. 221; CSP 3: 764; IH 2:
393; JW 2: 195, 3: 358-359, 5: 244; Kew 3: 327; Lasègue p. 347, 494, 506; NI (alph.); SK 1:
303, xxvi, xxxii; TL-2/1: 728.
Greshoff, M., Album der Natur 1903: 1-88.
Sirks, M. J., Ind. natuurond. 299 [index]. 1915.

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Fl. males, ser. I. 1: cl. 1950.

(1797-1823, q.v.); <em>Kuhlia</em> Humboldt, Bonpland &amp; Kunth (1825); <em>Kuhlia</em> Reinwardt (1825).

HEADING: KUHLMANN

Kuhlmann, João Geraldo (1882-1958), Brazilian botanist and collector at São Paulo.
(<em>Kuhlm</em>.)

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: RB; duplicates in many herbaria. For details on the numbering of K.
specimens see Prance (1971).
<em>Ref</em>.: Prance, G., Acta amaz. 1(1): 43. 1971 (itin.)

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 325; IH 2: 393-394; Kew 3: 327.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Kuhlmannia</em> J. C. Gomes fil. (1956); <em>Kuhlmanniella</em> Barroso (1945).

Kuhn, Friedrich Adalbert Maximilian ["Max"] (1842-1894), German pteridologist at
Berlin; Dr. phil. Berlin 1867; high school teacher at the Königstädtische Realschule (later
Gymnasium) from 1870-1893, from 1889 with the title of professor. (<em>Kuhn</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 51: 421-422; Barnhart 2: 326; BJI 1: 35; BM 2: 1033;
CSP 8: 133, 10: 133, 472, 12: 418, 16: 506; De Toni 1: lxxiii; GR p. 102; Hortus 3: 1197; IF
710-711; IH 2: 394; Jackson p. 346; Kew 3: 328; Moebius p. 359; MW p. 255; PR 4920-
4921; TL-2/1: 198, 1705; Urban-Berl. p. 320; Zander ed. 10, p. 681.
Anon., Bot. Not. 1895: 38; Bot. Zeit. 53(2): 14. 1899; Hedwigia 34(Rep.): 39. 1895.
Ascherson, P. F. A., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 13: (43)-(47). 1896 (bibl.); Verh. bot. Ver.
	Brandenburg 37: lxiv-lxix. 1896 (bibl.).
Dolezal, H., Friedrich Welwitsch 189. 1974.
Merrill, E. D., Contr. U.S. natl. Herb. 30(1): 180-181. 1947.
Urban, I., Fl. bras. 1(1): 183. 1906.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Martius, <em>Flora brasiliensis, Isoëtaceae, Marsiliaceae, Salviniaceae</em>, 1(2):
654-662, <em>pl. 78-82</em>. 1 Apr 1884.
(2) C. C. von der Decken, Baron C. C. von der Decken's <em>Reisen in Ost-Afrika</em> in 1859-61,
<em>Cryptogamae vasculares</em>, in vol.. 3, part 3, p. 7-71. 1879. [Botanik von Ost-Afrika by P.
Ascherson et al.].
(3) Engler, <em>Forschungsr. Gazelle, Fane</em>, p. [1]-20, <em>pl. i-iii</em>. 1889; see no. 1705.
(4) <em>Filices, in</em> Miquel, Ann. Mus. bot. Lugd.-Bat. 4: 267-288. Nov 1869-Feb 1870, 289-300.
Mar 1870.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Kuhniodes</em> Post &amp; O. Kuntze (1903) is related to <em>Kuhnia</em> Linnaeus (1763), which
commemorates Adam Kuhn (1741-1817), American botanist, who studied in Europe (pupil
of Linnaeus).

3983. <em>Filices Deckenianae</em>. Dissertatio inauguralis botanica quam consensu et auctoritate
amplissimi philosophorum ordinis in alma litterarum Universitate Friderica Guilelma ad
summos in philosophia honores rite capessendos die viii m. augusti a. mdccclxvii h.l.q.s.
publice defendet auctor Maximilianus Kuhn, Berolinensis. Adversarii erunt: P. Ascherson
... A. Kirchhoff ... E. Loew. Lipsiae [Leipzig] (typis Breitkopfii &amp; Haertelii) [1867]. Oct. (<em>Filic. Decken</em>.).

<em>Publ</em>.: 8 Aug 1867, p. [i-iii], [1]-26, [1, vita; 2, theses]. <em>Copies</em>: B, NY; IDC 7208. Note by
	Barnhart in NY copy: "This dissertation was the last botanical one in Latin at Berlin
	Univ." The text is also part of the <em>Filices africanae</em> (1868) (see 3984).

3984. <em>Filices africanae</em> revisio critica omnium hucusque cognitorum cormophytorum Africae
indigenorum additamentis Braunianis novisque africanis speciebus ex reliquiis Mettenianis
adaucta. Accedunt filices deckenianae et petersianae ... Lipsiae [Leipzig] (W. Engelmann)
1868. Oct. (<em>Filic. afr</em>.).

<em>Publ</em>.: Jan-Mar 1868 (p. 214: Dec 1837; Hedwigia Mar 1868; Flora 9 Jun 1868; Bot. Zeit. 21
	Aug 1868), p. [i], [1]-233. <em>Copies</em>: MO, U, US; IDC 5210.

	1868.

HEADING: KUMMER

3985. <em>Filices novarum hebridarum</em> ... [Wien (C. Ueberreuter (M. Salzer)) 1869]. Qu. (<em>Filic. nov. hebrid</em>.).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1869 (submitted 7 Jul 1869), p. [1]-18. <em>Copy</em>: G. – Reprinted from Verh. k.k. zool. bot.
	Ges. Wien. 1869: [569]-586.

Kummer, Georg (1885-1954), Swiss botanist born at Tayngen near Schaffhausen; studied
at Zürich; high school teacher and school inspector at Schaffhausen. (<em>G. Kumm</em>.)

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Kummer, Paul (1834-1912), German clergyman and lichenologist; private teacher 1857-
1863; from 1863-1877 curate at Zerbst; from 1877 minister at Hann.-Münden. (<em>P. Kumm</em>.)

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. Exsiccatae: <em>Der Führer in die Flechtenkunde</em>, ed. 1, 1874, has
14 dried specimens; ed. 2, 1883, lacks these specimens.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 326; BM 2: 1034; CSP 16: 510; GR p. 25, cat. p.
66; Hirsch p. 164; Jackson p. 568 [index]; Kew 3: 330; LS 14612-14617, 35693; PR 4926;
Rehder 5: 477; SBC p. 124 ("Kumm."); Stevenson p. 1248; Tucker 1: 402.
Lütjeharms, W. J., Gesch. Mykol. 221. 1936.
Urban, H., Z. Pilzk. 18: 112-113. 1934.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Kummerowia</em> A. K. Schindler (1912) is dedicated to the Polish scientist Kum-
merov.

Kunth, Carl Sigismund (1788-1850), German botanist; joined A. v. Humboldt in Paris
1813, to work on his New World collections, from 1829 professor of botany at the University
of Berlin. (<em>Kunth</em>).

PAGE: 693
HEADING: KUNTH

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Kunth's considerable private herbarium (60.000 specimens), con-
taining many of his types, was one of the basic herbaria of the Berlin general herbarium. The
Humboldt, Bonpland and Kunth types are mainly at P. Other material at BM, H, K. –
Original drawings for the <em>Mimoses</em> at Frankfurt, Senckenberg Bibliothek. – Other manus-
cript material at Institut de France.
<em>Ref</em>.: Anon., Bot. Zeit. 8: 568, 896. 1850 (herb, acquired by B), see also Bot. Not. 1851: 95.
	Stearn, W. T., Humboldt, Bonpland, Kunth and tropical American botany. Lehre 1966.
	Urban, I., Gesch. Berlin-Dahlem 23, 271, 288, 304, 366. 1916.
	Bouteron et Tremble, Cat. gén. manusc. bibl. publ. France, Paris 1928, p. 224 (252
	"impressions de plantes" at Inst, de France).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 17: 394-397; AG 2(2): 512; Backer p. 308; Barnhart 2:
327; BM 2: 1034-1035; Bossert p. 223; Bret. p. 279; CSP 3: 773-774, 12: 419, 16: 511; Frank
3(Anh.): 54; GR p. 25; Hortus 3: 1197 ("Kunth"); IF 711; IH 2: 396; Jackson p. 568
[index]; Kew 3: 333-334; Langman p. 421-422; LS 14622; MD 170-172; Moebius p. 278;
MW p. 278; MW p. 256; NI 1111-1112; PR 4927-4939 (ed. 1: 5450-5464); Rehder 5: 477; RS

The book contains a selection of 60 leguminosae from the Nova genera et species (3143).
	Many of the descriptions are almost identical. For dates see TL-1/618.
	For an outstanding modern reproduction of thirteen of the plates, taken directly from the
	originals in the library of the Senckenbergische naturforschende Gesellschaft, accom-
	panied by an extensive essay by Franz Lerner and notes on the illustrations see Lerner
	(1968.)

	d'espèces nouvelles ou peu connues, dessinées par Madame Eulalie Delile..." Paris
	(Librarie-Gide, ...) 1835, 2 vols., Fol.
	<em>1</em>: [i, ii], [1]-614.
	<em>2</em>: [i*, iii*]. [i]-xlv, <em>pl. 1-220</em> (as in 1829 issue).
	<em>Copy</em>: U (uncol.). – Other copies show mixtures of the original 1829 issue and this reissue.
	The order of issue of the 44 parts was more irregular than that of the original edition. Since
	this issue has no bearing on nomenclature, however, these dates are not given here. They
	can be ascertained from the contemporary literature. At least 8 parts were issued by 1835,
	and at least 30 had been published by Jun 1836.
<em>Ref</em>.: NI 954, 1111 (<em>Distr</em>.); RS p. 91; SK 4: cxciv; IDC 5994.
	Kuntze, O., Rev. gen. 1: cxxxi. 1891.
	Sherborn C. D., &amp; Woodward, A. S., J. Bot. 39: 205. 1901.
	Steenis-Kruseman, M. J. van, Fl. males. Bull. 15: 736. 1960.

4013. <em>Lehrbuch der Botanik</em> ... Erster Theil. Allgemeine Botanik: Organographie, Phy-

<em>Publ</em>.: 1847, p. [i]-xii, [1]-588. <em>Copies</em>: B, L, M, NY.

Kuntze, Carl Ernst Otto (1843-1907), German traveller, botanist and polemic nomencla-
tural reformer; Dr. phil. Freiburg i.B. 1878; travelled around the world 1874-1876 and in
1904. (<em>Kuntze</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: NY (32.000, acquired "through the generosity of Mr. Andrew
Carnegie", Britten 1908). The European section of the herbarium was subsequently given to
CHARL (Barnhart 1913). K's large collection of botanical illustrations, <em>Thesaurus iconurn</em>,
142 folio volumes, was acquired by Karl Lauterbach, who left this collection to the Breslau
botanical institute (now WRSL).
<em>Ref</em>.: Urban, I., Symb. ant. 1: 90. 1898, 3: 70-71. 1902; Fl. bras. 1(1): 36-38. 1906; Gesch.
	Berlin-Dahlem p. 271, 304, 366, 320. 1917.
	Anon., Torreya 8: 37. 1908.
	Britton, N. L., New York Bot. Gard. 9: 19-21. 1908.
	Sayre, G., Mem. New York bot. Gard. 19(3): 353. 1975.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 4: 878-879; Backer p. 308; Barnhart 2: 327; BJI 1: 35;
BM 2: 1035; Bossert p. 223; CSP 8: 137, 10: 478, 12: 419, 16: 512; De Toni 1: lxxiii, 4: xxxiv;
DTS 1: 163; GR p. 25; Hortus 3: 1197 ("Kuntze, O."); IF 711-712; Jackson p. 97, 101, 128,
142; Kew 3: 334-336; KR p. 360; Langman p. 422; LS 14623-14625; Moebius p. 57; MW p.
256; NW p. 50; PR 4940-4941; RS p. 111; SBC p. 124 ("Kuntze"); SK 1: 304-305, 4: 304-
305; SO 291, 880, 882; Tucker 1: 403; Zander ed. 10, p. 681.
Anon., Bot. Not. 1907: 168; Oesterr. bot. Z. 57: 135. 1907; The Orchid Review 1907: 66-67;
	Torreya 7: 88. 1907; Tribuna farmaceutica 1943: 218.
Barnhart, J. H., Bull. Charleston Museum 9: 65-68. 1913.
Blatter, E., Fl. Aden 15. 1914.
Britten, J., J. Bot. 45: 127. 1907.
Britton, N. L. Bull. Torrey Bot. Cl. 19: 50. Feb 1892.

Ewan, J., Rocky Mountain naturalists 246. 1950.

	3(2): post 201. 1898 (bibl.); Bot. Jahrb. 27, Beibl. 63: 6. 1900 ("Berichtigung Buchenau-
	Engler'scher falscher Angaben ...").

	reform).

	des kundigsten, sachlichsten und uneigennützigsten Förderers einer einheitlichen Pflan-

4014. <em>Taschen-Flora von Leipzig</em>. Beschreibung und Standortsangabe der in dem Bezirk von
vier Meilen um Leipzig einheimischen, häufig gebauten und verwilderten Gefässpflanzen,
zum Gebrauch auf Excursionen und fur Schulen verfasst von Otto Kuntze, ... Angeordnet
nach dem natürlichen System von Alexander Braun, nebst besonderem Schlüssel des
künstlichen Systems von Carl von Linné. Leipzig und Heidelberg (C. F. Winter'sche

<em>Publ</em>.: 20 Sep 1899 (journal), p. [1]-8. <em>Copy</em>: G. – Reprinted and to be cited from Bot.
