Léveillé, Joseph Henri (1796-1870), French physician and mycologist at Paris; Dr. med.
Paris 1824; one of the discoverers of the basidium. (<em>Lév</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Léveillé's herbarium and most of his manuscripts were destroyed
during the Franco-Prussian war of 1870-1871. However, many duplicates had been sent to
Montagne (now at PC). Léveillé also sent some early material to Persoon for determination
(now at L) and later identified part of the other Leiden and Paris collections of fungi. E. S.
Salmon (1900) states that the collection of <em>Erysiphaceae</em> at K "is especially valuable in
containing Berkeley's herbarium. In this occur, besides Berkeley's types, no less than 98
specimens sent by Léveillé to this author ..." Salmon, Donk (private comm.) and
Hawksworth cite indeed Léveillé material from K. Koster cites Léveillé algae from BM.
Some further mycological herbarium is at K.
<em>Ref</em>.: Salmon, Mem. Torrey bot. Club 9: 26. 1900.
	Koster, J. T. Taxon 18: 555. 1969.
	Sayre, G., Mem. New York Bot. Gard. 19(3): 359. 1975.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Léveillé described the basidium in Ann. Sci. nat., Bot. ser. 2: 8: 321-328. 1837; he was
preceded by F. M. Ascherson, Arch. Naturgesch. 2: 372. 1836.
<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 6(1): 276; Ainsworth p. 344; Barnhart 2: 374; BM 3:
1101-1102; CSP 3: 988; Frank 3(Anh.): 57; GR p. 286-287, cat. p. 67; Hawksworth p. 184;
IH 2: 436; Jackson p. 572; Kew 3: 424; Lasègue p. 574; LS 15300-15338, 35964; NAF 9(6):
441, 7(15): 1075; PR 5259-5262 (ed. 1: 5821-5834); Rehder 5: 507; SBC p. 125 ("Lév.");
Stevenson p. 1249; TL-2/1: 1363, 1598, 1969, see Demidow, A. N.; TR 775-777; Tucker 1:
425; Urban-Berl. p. 266, 278, 288, 305, 369.

PAGE: 866
HEADING: LÉVEILLÉ, J. H.

Levier, Emile [Emilio] (1839-1911), Swiss-born physician, botanist and plant collector in
Firenze; specialist on Ricciaceae. (<em>Levier</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: FI (47.000), G (30.000); duplicates widely distributed, see IH.
Distributed various named series of plants, e.g. <em>Bryotheca exotica</em>, ser. 1, nos. 1-100, Firenze
1907.

Levyns, Margaret Rutherford Bryan (née Mitchell) (1890-1975), South African botan-
ist; lecturer at the University of Cape Town 1916-1946; first woman president of the Royal
Society of South Africa. (<em>Levyns</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BOL (11.731 S. African specimens, collected between 1922 and
1970). The collection from Australia is also at BOL. Important sets of duplicates are at K and
PRE.
<em>Ref</em>.: Rourke, J., in M.R.B. Levyns, Insnar'd with flow'rs. Cape Town 1977, p. 199-200.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Andrews p. 68; Barnhart 2: 375; BL 1: 29, 305; Bossert p.
236; Hortus 3: 1198 ("Levyns"); IH 2: 438; Kew 3: 426; Roon p. 68.

HEADING: LEVYNS

	Bot. Soc. S. Afr.).

4475. <em>Notes on new and rarer species of Diatomaceae</em>, of the United States seaboard. Philadelphia
(Merrihew &amp; Thompson, printers, ...) 1861. Oct.

Leybold, Friedrich (1827-1879), German botanist and pharmacist; pupil of Martius;

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Leydolt, Franz (1810-1859), Austrian mineralogist and botanist at Vienna: Dr. med. Wien
1837; assistant with J. F. von Jacquin 1838; from 1843 at the Vienna polytechnic, from 1847
as professor of mineralogy and geognosy. (<em>Leyd</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 2: 377; BM 3: 1107; CSP 3: 999, 12: 445; Kew 3:
434; PR 5264.

4482. Dissertatio inauguralis botanica <em>de Plantagineis</em> quam consensu et auctoritate illus-
trissimi ac magnifici domini praesidis et directoris, perillustris et spectabilis d.d. professorum
pro doctoris medicinae laurea summisque in medicina honoribus et privilegiis rite et legitime
obtinendis in antiquissima atque celeberrima universitate vindobonensi publicae disqui-
sitioni submittit Franciscus Leydolt. Austriacus viennensis. Cum tabula lith. In theses
adnexas disputabitur in Universitatis aedibus die I. Julii 1837. Vindobonae [Wien] (typis
Joanni s B. Wallishausser). Oct. (<em>De Plantagin</em>.)

<em>Publ</em>.: 1 Jul 1837, p. [i-viii], [i]-54, <em>1 pl. Copy</em>: MO.
<em>Trade edition</em>: 1837, p. [i-viii], [1]-54, [1-2], <em>1 pl</em>. (uncol.). <em>Copies</em>: G, MO, NY. - <em>Die
	Plantagineen</em> in Bezug auf die naturhistorische Spezies, von Franz Leydolt, Doctor der
	Medizin. (Mit einer Lithographirten Tafel.) Wien (gedruckt bei J. B. Wallishauser) s.d.
	[1837]. Oct. - This re-issue came out undated, hence the citation of other year-dates in the
	literature. There was only this one re-issue. The original thesis issue seems to be very rare.
<em>Ref</em>.: BM 3: 1107 (dates this at 1833); PR 5264 (ed. 1: 5839).
